rComments: Favorite professor by far. Such a caring and intelligent person, and it is truly to a pleasure to listen to his lectures. There is quite a lot of homework, but he rewards students for engaging with the content and he's really nice. Also, extremely knowledgeable in his field. :)

Easily the best prof I've had. His lectures are entertaining and the amount of coursework was moderate. The mid-terms (2) were multiple choice, if you attend the classes and do a little studying they're easy to 100%. His marking isn't the easiest, but it is fair and he will take the time to help you achieve the best marks you can.

He's by far one of my favourite professors at uOttawa. His classes are always interesting and fun. There is quite a lot of homework for this course, but other than that it's an easy A. This prof is truly a gem.
I love him so much, he makes you work hard but he's an amazing person and lecturer.
Best prof

Although his class is an easy A, he makes you work for your grade. So, be prepared to write a lot of assignments. I do not think grammar ever mattered to him as English is not his first language. He mainly looks at your ideas. Beside that, he is an excellent prof, who is obviously an expert in Russian culture.

He's a very caring professor, who although tends to give out alot of assignments, he is a very fair grader and there's no way you can fail the class, as long as you put in at least a little bit of effort. I love this guy!

Arkadi doesn't get the 5 for being easy. If anything with the volume of homework, he does make you work for your mark. But every last second of class with him is worth it. He was absolutely incredible and sympathetic, very accommodating with deadlines. Russian is not easy, but he makes it almost fun. Respect the class and put in the effort.

He CARES. Like, a lot. His lectures are funny, detailed, and you learn things even when you think you aren't. He's fair and a good grader, not easy but not "screw you". TRY in class and he will be there for you. A literal gem. I cannot possibly overstate just how much I love the Russian language because of him, I switched minors to Russian.

One of my favourite profs at the university! He gives great feedback on papers and is not a tough marker. If you attend class and listen you'll surely get a good mark. A great, easy elective if you need one. Just be prepared to write lots of papers.

Not only is this course an easy 2000 level elective but Arkadi teaches the course in a way that genuinely makes you want to come to class and learn. I whole-heartedly enjoyed being in his class, he is very passionate about the material and he is very passionate about making time for his students and engaging them. 100/10 would take his class again.

Best prof I have ever had! His lectures are interesting, not difficult but you can learn a lot of information from them, you will receive a good grade if you really look through the materials. The only thing that i was confused about is the 5% of participation-- There's no attendence and i have no ideas about how that works.

prof has intriguing lectures but a lot is off topic. otherwise soewhat clear grading criteria but is generous with the marks. very rich information learend in class and very intersting. no textbook + readings required really except a few minor thhings

Absolutely one of the best professors I've ever had. He is very passionate about the subject matter and he comes to class with a smile. He remembers his past students well. Although none of the RUS-series classes are mandatory for my degree, I will keep taking them just to have this professor again!

If I could suggest any professor in this school, Arkadi would be the one. He is THE BEST professor I have ever had. He is hilarious, understanding, so incredibly caring and the most amazing man in the world. If you could take a class, it doesn't matter which class it is, TAKE IT. Any class with him is absolutely incredible.

J'ai eu 3 cours avec M. Klioutchanski. C'est le meilleur professeur que j'ai eu à l'université et dans toute mon éducation. L'ayant eu tant dans le cours de langue russe que dans les cours de cultures russe, M. Kli. arrive toujours en classe prêt à donner son cours, dont il connaît la matière et en est passionné. Il est notre messie, notre sauveur.

Great professor who never fails to help and re-explain things. Very helpful, and really wants everyone to pass. Don't skip class because a lot of confusing parts are explained repeatedly in class. Easy marker, but be prepared for 2nd half of course. It's assignment and test heavy, with a LOT of grammar. Try to read ahead during reading week.

Arkadi is an incredible professor. He does not believe in teaching by rote memory exercises, but instead, helped us practice speaking, writing, and reading almost every class. He is very accessible outside of class and is willing to help you understand a topic even if youre no longer his student. Hope to have him again!

Arkadi is a great prof in the sense that he's super nice and approachable and a very generous grader. He's always there during office hours if you have questions, so don't be shy. He is, however, a little all over the place and can be disorganized. I learned a lot though, and he was always willing to clarify anything you don't understand. Fun class

Arkadi is very accommodating and an amazing professor. He is very helpful and do not be afraid to see him during his office hours. He's definitely there for you and wants you to succeed (and learn Russian!).
Wonderful course and wonderful professor. He is very understanding and willing to help you with your mistakes. Would definitely recommend.

Lectures with him can be very long and boring, so he might put you to sleep, but the material overall is very interesting. Get ready to write papers because there is four of them and one midterm.  GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! He is very helpful! He knows a lot, and talks a lot, so you'll have to write down a lot really fast. No slides or text book.

Arkadi is a wonderful person, and I did learn a lot in his class. It seemed, however, that he was very disorganized and his classes lacked structure. Homework is due almost every class. Come to class prepared to participate!

Very forgiving and accommodating prof. He's funny, his subject matter is interesting and he is always willing to be helpful. If you're not in A Russian language class he won't use slides and his lecture style is dependent on class participation and discussion. I highly recommend him.

Amazing professor, very understanding. The stuff he teaches you is very difficult, but he's a very easy marker. As long as you try, you'll do well. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you won't pass if you skip.

He was one of my favourite profs ever.  He made lectures worth going to and not boring whatsoever, hilarious! He actually teaches you russian and helps you in the learning process, doesn't use ppt.  Definitely recommend this course with him, you'll learn a lot! fav prof

No PPTs, actually Russian. Clearly knows his stuff but could be clearer with explanations, though I don't blame him. Attending class is a must, you might miss something important. There's no textbook to study off of.
Awesome prof, great candid lectures with open discussions, not heavy on slides. One of the few classes I actually enjoyed going to.
Great Professor, he is intelligent, very clear, and helpful. Best prof in the department of Russian language.

Though I hate to admit it, hes not the clearest at explaining things, but his engaging lecture (more like big group discussion) style makes class more than worth it. Hilarious; genuinely cares abt students instead of trying to trick them. Makes you want to do your best. Be prepared to come to class & listen if you want to learn; he doesn't use PPTs

Demonstrates a honest will and adroit ability to help understand the material he brings forth. May seem quick to dismiss the opinions or suggestions of students when he deems their addition impertinent, but is happily argumentative if approached about an issue outside of class. But caveat if he offers you to take a look inside his Overcoat.

He is a good prof who is Russian. He teaches my Russian cinema class and knows what he's talking about because he has watched all of the movies. He knows how to teach and is likable. He is nice and doesn't give too much homework.
Very enjoyable class. Prof had great insights and was very knowledgable. Two thumbs up!
No Comments
Very nice guy, pretty charismatic, challenging but not too hard.
Very good prof. Very helpful. Goes out of the way to help his students. Hope he gets tenure some day. He's part-time now.
No Comments
Very helpful and very sweet. Good teacher. Just a nice guy.
